Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards

Class HuntEffect

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards.Effect
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards.HuntEffect
public abstract class HuntEffect extends Effect

A Hunt! effect.

Supposed to exist only within a Rumour card (relation of composition).

abstract, instantiated anonymously with a redefinition of the Effect.perform() method. The Effect.isAllowed() method can be overriden too if needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • HuntEffect

      public HuntEffect()

      Plural Hunt! effects make you chooseNextPlayer() choose the next player.

      Makes sure the description and default value of these effects is shared.

      The Effect.perform() method must be redefined with chooseNextPlayer() only.

    • HuntEffect

      public HuntEffect(String desc, int value)

      Instantiates a Hunt! effect with its Effect.description and its integer default value.

      Effect.perform() must, and Effect.isAllowed() can, be redefined.

      Parameters:
      desc - This effect's Effect.description. Each "newline" character can be followed by a "/+/" sequence to build multiline, dynamically indented, paragraphs.
      value - This effect's Effect.value default value. Corresponds to the value given by a CPU Players' strategies to this effect in its initial state.
      See Also:
      • Effect.description
      • Effect.value
      • CardValue::getHuntValue()

  • Method Details

    • getMyself

      protected Player getMyself()
      Specified by:
      getMyself in class Effect
      Returns:
      The player triggering this Hunt! effect, that is to say the current hunting player.
      See Also:
      • Tabletop::getHunter()

    • getTarget

      protected Player getTarget()
      Useful only for a few Hunt! effects.
      Specified by:
      getTarget in class Effect
      Returns:
      The player targetted by this Hunt! effect, that is to say the the current hunted player.
      See Also:
      • Tabletop::getHuntedPlayer()

    • chooseNextPlayer

      public Player chooseNextPlayer()
      Makes the player triggering this effect choose an adversary to play the next turn. Also designates the chosen next player as the hunted target.
      Overrides:
      chooseNextPlayer in class Effect
      Returns:
      The Player who was chosen to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • Effect.getMyself()
      • Player::chooseNextPlayer()
